title: I actually want Vayne to be nerfed, but...
body:
...I am getting tired of the boards being spammed with "Nerf Vayne" threads.

I mean, is she so stupidly OP, Pre-Rework Kassadin/v4.20 Warwick/pre-hotfix Skarner level of brokeness? If she was that powerful she would already been hotfixed a long time ago, you don't need to create numerous "Nerf Vayne" threads, this is getting extremely boring because I actually want to see discussions of other champions that need to be discussed. For example, I always go to the boards expecting a thread about Kha'Zix changes, as he desperately need them, and then I get disappointed as I run into "Nerf Vayne" threads.

Does she needs nerfs? On my opinion yes. She gets her powerspike too early and it is impossible to out-trade her currently.

Does that mean Riot doesn't already acknowledge that? No. They are probably waiting for the Marksman update before doing any changes to her.

Does that mean you should spam the boards with "Nerf Vayne" threads? Hell, no!

replies.body:
Even if she is deserving of nerfs, most of the spammed threads just try to outright gut her by targetting her self-peel or Silver Bolts when there are so many other areas which could be altered.  Some possibilities are:

* Lower base attack speed
* Lower attack speed per level
* Lower base damage on E
* E doesn't reapply damage if the target hits terrain
* E doesn't apply a stack of Silver Bolts
* Higher cooldown on her ultimate
* Lower base AD
* Lower AD per level
* Lower bonus AD on her ultimate (reduce by 5/10/15 at ranks 1/2/3) by reverting a previous buff.

Instead, a lot of people suggest removing her ability to duel champions, her percent health true damage, her passive movement speed, or her stealth.  They are all core components of Vayne's identity; there are plenty of other areas which may be targeted to reduce her strength.
I would honeslty be happy if riot just nerfed her by 5 ad.

http://www.surrenderat20.net/2015/09/929-pbe-update.html#more

Regarding her true damage, she should definitely keep the %HP part, but they could actually remove the flat damage and increase the percentage to 6/7/8/9/10%, and she'd only start dealing more damage if her target had over 3000 HP. Thus keeping her as a tank buster.

Or they could just remove the flat damage, because she could probably still do pretty well with just 8% every 3 hits (even if it is one of the weakest %HP DPS abilities in the game).

Either option would be a reasonable nerf.

I generally just have issues when people suggest changing it to physical damage, magical damage, or percent bonus health.  Many of them don't really think the changes through very well.

I wouldn't say that it is one of the weakest %HP DPS abilities. It technically deals low damage, but it's TRUE damage... You must take that into consideration because almost every %HP DPS is physical or magical and not all of them are backed by penetration.

I never called Silver Bolts a weak %HP damage ability.  My main complaint was that some people don't actually understand the ramifications of the changes they suggest.

If you change it to physical or magic damage without adjusting the ratio, then the ability becomes extremely weak.

If you adjust the ratio after changing the damage type, then it will deal more damage to squishy targets (which ADCs don't need help killing) and less to tanky targets (since they have the resistences to reduce it).

Changing it to percent bonus health damage would gut the ability since she wouldn't actually be able to trade during laning phase.  Vayne is already outranged by many ADCs with a poke ability (i.e. Buckshot, Piercing Light, Double Up, Mystic Shot, Phosphorous Bomb) and ADCs don't typically build health.  The ability wouldn't be relevant until much later in the game and it wouldn't be useful if the enemy team stacked primarily resistances (since they wouldn't have very much bonus health).

We're currently testing a small reduction to Vayne's starting AD, our belief being that Vayne's currently got too strong a lane for how powerful her late game is (with the strong late game a defining feature of hers and a strong lane not intended). That nerf's deliberately being kept small given the changes to a number of marksmen and marksmen items in the coming preseason and the belief that we're currently seeing a solo queue meta that's very favorable to Vayne (lot of tanky dudes to fight). Post preseason disruption we'll then assess both Vayne and marksmen in general, see where changes are or aren't needed.

When you guys are doing that assessment, could you guys also specifically look at all the flat numbers in her kit, specifically the flat true damage on her W and the rather large AD Steroid on her ultimate?

i have qualms with vayne being the best tank killer i feel that this realyl should be kogmaw
Why can't they both be this but with different strengths?

Our belief is that there's room in the tank killer space for both Vayne and Kog, since they offer pretty different takes on it. While both are really effective against high health targets, and have at least some capacity to shred or ignore mitigation, they're pretty different otherwise. Kog's got a decent amount of poke, even with an AD build, has much greater average attack range come late game and offers some team utility (shred, slow, vision). He needs to be protected pretty carefully though, getting a lot of value from speed boosts and peel in particular, so places demands on his team's comp. Vayne by contrast's got high sustained mobility and functions well independently (she's got a number of duelist traits). She brings very little team utility however, and lacks both AOE and ability to affect enemies outside of her auto attack range. 

Whether or not the two are are appropriately balanced, relative to each other and other marksmen, gets a lot of debate, we're pretty confident there's enough room within the space of 'tank killing marksmen' for both Kog and Vayne though.

Almost every adc is forced to build IE, phantom/shyv because that's the quickest road to the highest dps most of the time and vayne outdamages them with botrk + phantom/shyv due to her true damage steroid (while also having a decent amount of lifesteal mixed into her strengths)

This is only around 32 bonus ad including BOTRK and doran's blade built by her and she's getting the max benefit of her silver bolts at a very early stage of the game.

I think a possible way to fix  and delay her power spike is to add an AD ratio to the silver bolts % max health while also lowering the base damage (both the flat and the % max health). My reasoning for this is so that late game, once she has IE, BOTRK, LW  etc,  she will put out around similar numbers in regards to % max health on silver bolts and not have quite such a strong power spike once she gets her BOTRK.

See, this is where I have to disagree with you. Vayne is hybridized damage herself. But unlike Koggles who is Physical and Magical, Vayne gets the arguably better Physical and **true** damage hybridization. How does this become even better? Her true damage is based on the targets **maximum** health. Meaning that building to counter it just causes it to hit even harder.

If Koggles built to make his W hit harder, all the tank has to do is stack up magic resist. What can a tank do to save themselves from Vayne's silver bolt? They have to kamikaze her and die killing her or have one of their carries snipe her off. 

I would love Koggles to be the tank killer, but that isn't him. He's the immobile artillery. Akin to a howitzer.

Kogmaw also has dramatically higher range. They both also deal percentage of max health, but Kog's q also allows him to lower the resistances of his target, something that Vayne cannot do. 
You counter percent max health damage by building more resistances than health. This goes for both champions. Kog is a tank killer, much safer but much more vulnerable than Vayne. He also deals hybrid damage vs ad/true damage. It's harder to itemize against the entirety of his kit because it requires both resistances, but Vayne's is unavoidable if you can get 3rd procs without dying from 550 range.

My issue with nerfing Vayne (and i do want her nerfed) is that you weaken her laning so much she can no longer win as easily when outplayed.  Then she falls behind and the enemy Marksmen is getting fed. Now there is a fed Marksmen and Vayne is giving up because "f*ck Rito balance gg". Of course this is an extreme example (maybe...) but i do see this as a serious issue.  

The reason i have issue with this is if that Vayne player is smart they will be able to come back and come back hard, but a bad Vayne player (and there are a lot of them) will give up and automatically assume the game is over. Then the boards will be spammed with "Buff Vayne" (and probably GG Riot, Fire Balance Team, etc...) and then she will get buffed again. Which will make it meaningless to have nerfed her in the first place. I know champions are generally buffed or nerfed based on how they are played at higher levels of play but still i think it could end up being an issue for her balance. The opposite would be this nerf doesn't do anything to her laning phase or she can go even with any ADC. This is still a problem because in first one she is still overbearing and in the second one the enemy is struggling meanwhile Vayne hits her spike and its no longer even. 

I would suggest, if possible, to look for a solution that doesn't just straight weaken her laning phase but makes it more difficult to perform at the same levels she is performing at currently. Probably easier said then done, but all those "nerf Vayne" fanatics need to realize they will have Vayne's on their team. You do not want a crappy weak Vayne on your team who is then going to quit because she was "nerfed too hard".
